Package org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree

Class TripCountingRootCatchup

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree.TripCountingRootCatchup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RootCatchup
    public class TripCountingRootCatchup
extends Object
implements RootCatchup
    This class counts the number of round trips we take from the same node back to root in a row and throw TreeInconsistencyException if it becomes too many.

    Starting over from root happens when a seek cursor ended up on an unexpected node, such as

    • Node is internal when we actually expect it to be a leaf.
    • Generation of node is higher than the generation of the pointer that we followed to get here.
    • Generation of the node differs from the generation we expected it to have based on previous lookup.
    • Node is not a tree node.
    All of those cases are either a result of a concurrent update changing the structure of the tree, e.g. if the page we wanted to visit was reused for something else before we got there, or the tree is in an inconsistent state. If the tree is inconsistent it is likely that we end up here again after retrying from root and thus we will loop here forever. To avoid this we keep track of the last page that we jumped to root from and if we loop from the same place enough times we will throw an exception.
